Authors:
Wanhao Chen, Yanfeng Han, Zongqi Liang, Jiandong Liang,
Xiao Zou, Daochao Jin
Title:
Speciation of a novel Metarhizium species derived from
Inter-species recombination events
Keywords:
Entomopathogenic fungi, inter-species, mitochondrial
ribosomal genes, recombinant, speciation
Abstract:
Recombination in some asexual fungi has been detected by
genetic studies, and the reported recombination in the genus Metarhizium
usually occurs among the intra-species. In this study, we report a novel
Metarhizium species, Metarhizium nostocoideum sp. nov., with determinate
synnemata derived from inter-species recombination events. Putative
recombinant sequences were identified with the use of SimPlot and RDP
program. Recombination events were confirmed by bootscaning, using
putative recombinant sequence as a query. Statistical support for the
presence of a recombination event was done by the use of GARD program
and several algorithms, including RDP, GENECONV, BootScan, MaxChi,
Chimaera, SiScan, and 3Seq in Recombination Detection Program version
4.22. The result revealed that the recombination parents were
Metacordyceps chlamydosporia and Metacordyceps pseudoatrovirens. The
inference of recombination in mitochondrial genes suggests that the
combination may through somatic recombination and the Metarhizium
nostocoideum sp. nov. was a recombinant.
